nodes.bodyText: Lets make the CloudRegionInfo a mutable object: add no args constructor, remove final and change @Value to @Data  to use ControllerTestUtils#assertResponse method
Could you please replace constructor creation with @NoArgsConstructor?
Are this constants shall be public?

Could you please move constants to fields as much as it possible to avoid magic values?
Do not forget to add final
In general, I see no point to use argument captor here and elsewhere in this class. But if for some reasons it necessary let's discuss it.
Maybe we should consider implementation common method to avoid such routine? Also, it would be grate to add same method for unauthorized case.
Could we move it to class fields to reuse? (new TypeReference<Result<List<AwsRegion>>>() { })

It looks like all the calls to ControllerTestUtils.assertResponse in this test class as well as all the others have the same second argument. Moreover in order to use assertResponse expected result should be built beforehand using ControllerTestUtils.buildExpectedResult method.
I suppose we can introduce overloaded ControllerTestUtils.assertResponse method with only three arguments which builds expected result and compares it with an actual result. In order to do that ControllerTestUtils can be transformed to a regular bean.
What do you think @ekazachkova? Does it worth trying?
Let's remove ControllerTestUtils class and place all it's methods to  AbstractControllerTest
Could you move it to class fields?
I would prefer to use constructor injection. (add @RequiredArgsConstructor and make fields public)
